interestingcomments.content:
weird thing happens when I open .RAF files in windows image viewer /!/ So for a few seconds the images look how they were straight out of camera. However, all of the sudden the images change entirely and look way different. In this image that I have linked, its almost as if a perspective filter or something is applied... and I've literally done nothing to the image. Does anyone know why this is happening?

[image when first opened](https://imgur.com/a/9qh9eUT)

[image after a few seconds](https://imgur.com/a/X3cPdAP)

[image opened in c1](https://imgur.com/a/qOwjGCE) (looks pretty much the same as the windows viewer one)

&#x200B;

Also, I was reading around and heard someone say that the image adjustments in the Q menu (highlights, color, etc) can change how the image looks in camera vs the actual raw file. Could this be what's causing the problem? I'd think that if that were so, then the image would look different than in capture one, but idk.
